data.title: Remove iOS Extender
data.body: It was for dealing with PDF files. No idea why it was in here!

data.title: Fix runtime error on Mac platform when setting the Title.  Was throwing ...
data.body: ...NoImplemented exception because Title is checking if Window is null or not.  If it is still null at this point it will throw that error.  Moving it to OnLoad works.

data.title: MediaPlayer.IsRepeating fix
data.body: Fixes multi-song playback for Windows platforms, and repeating a queue of songs for all other platforms.

data.title: monogame 3.2 installs to 3.0 folder
data.body: Shouldn't the installer for version 3.2 install inside a 3.2 folder? I checked and it installs to a 3.0 folder... I don't know if this is done on purpose...

data.title: Misc Fixes
data.body:
A few small random fixes:
- We were not properly handling disposed constant buffers.
- Moved shader model validation from the MGFX parser into the code.

data.title: Corrupted textures on Android after resume.
data.body: After going to background and bringing app back, all textures are corrupted (black rectangles). I draw my own primitives (not using textures) and they are ok.

data.title: Fix android texture death on resume
data.body:
Reload graphics in SurfaceCreated instead of CreateFrameBuffer. This is where the documentation suggests it should be done.

Fixes #2427 - Please see this thread for comments and a test app.

data.title: Warning cleanup
data.body:
This fixes quite a few of the warnings in the current build.

A lot of them are caused by bad comments.
Some by changes to OpenTK.
All the iOS changes are deprecated APIs.

There are still more warnings. We will see what the build bot has to say!

I know that iOS has iOSGamePlatform.IsPlayingVideo which is marked as Obsolete, and causes a lot of warnings.
This has the comment "iOSGamePlatform.IsPlayingVideo must be removed when MonoGame fully implements the XNA VideoPlayer contract.".

Also it uses GKPeerConnectionState which is deprecated in iOS7, but it doesn't look like we can remove it without a fair bit of work.

There are also more warnings in the Content Processor files I haven't touched. Mostly fields that are never set. I'm not sure if these are required for marshalling or anything along those lines, so I've left them.

refs #2433

data.title: Pipeline GUI Tool
data.body:
This is the first commit of the Pipeline GUI tool for nice visual editing of the new MonoGame content pipeline command files.  The tool looks like this:

![pipeline](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/103522/2826714/104909b8-cf76-11e3-8045-b49b7210165f.png)

It currently has the following basic features which makes it usable immediately:
- Loading, saving, and creating new pipeline project files.
- Adding and removing existing content to the project.
- Change importers and processors as well as its properties.
- Build, rebuild, and clean content.
- No dependence on Microsoft XNA or Visual Studio.

It was built using C# and WinForms specifically for Windows support.  We have a simplified MVC design intended to allow someone to eventually implement a new IView for MacOS and Linux.

Our next steps here are to get feedback from users, iterate on the core features, and improve the functionality.  A few things on our roadmap for the tool:
- Editing custom processor assembly lists.
- System for per-platform content/settings.
- Support for linked content files.
- Better property editors.
- Undo/redo stack.
- Actual help docs.
- Recent file lists.
- Proper unloading of processor assemblies.
- Adding tool to MG installer and registering file extensions.
- Triggering .mgcb building directly from Visual Studio build.
- Import existing .contentproj files.

Thanks to @jamesford42 for making all the treeview and property grid work correctly.

data.title: Process hold gestures even if no gesture events are occurring.
data.body:
This PR fixes a problem wherein hold gestures are not recognised promptly, or sometimes at all.

Currently, new gestures are only checked for when _gestureEvents is non-empty. However, Android at least does not add to _gestureEvents while a touch location stays still, and it seems plausible that other platforms behave similarly.

This causes a hold gesture to not be recognised unless and until the user moves the touch location (at least slightly) at some point after the appropriate time has passed. If the hold is released without moving, the hold gesture is not processed at all. As a result, the hold gesture is unreliable unless the user deliberately waits, then performs a small motion to trigger it.

This commit causes gestures to be processed unconditionally of whether any new gesture events were received, allowing the hold gesture to be recognised and processed properly after the passage of the appropriate amount of time.

data.title: Cocos2DXNA Modifications for Production Games
data.body: Mostly changes from the PSM side of MonoGame, our own modifications to Threading, including adding it to the WIndows8 platform, and some PRs that were not merged into MG upstream but ones that we felt were useful for our user base.

data.title: 2MGFX x64
data.body:
This fixes the 2MGFX tool to be 64bit exclusively.
- Matches the MGCB which is now 64bit.
- Has to be 64bit eventually for MacOS.
- Some console libraries can be 64bit only.
- Forced removal of crappy MS XNA dependency.
- Updated solution/project to VS2012.

data.title: Build Log Cleanup
data.body:
This PR updates to the latest Protobuild which supports disabling build warnings.  I disabled the following warnings which generate 1000s of messages in the build logs:
- Disabled missing XML comment warnings [CS1591](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/zk18c1w9.aspx).
- Disabled type conflicts across assemblies for WinPhone [CS0436](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/h6ys1ykk.aspx).

data.title: Rectangle's Contains(...) is inconsistent with border checks
data.body:
When checking for if a coordinate is contained within a rectangle, the left border is included, along with the top border, but the right one is not and neither is the bottom one. This leads to that coordinates being on the rightmost (or bottommost) border are not contained within the Rectangle, whereas coordinates on the other borders are reported as contained.

![borders](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1521109/2810874/05128dc0-cdf1-11e3-9cd9-62fae49d6356.png)

_An illustration of the afforementioned issue where the green area will be returned as contained and the red area as not contained. Note that all coloured area is part of the rectangle, defined as the tuple (0, 0, 3, 3)._

I found this when Unit Tests for my own code was failing because it relied on MonoGame. I subsequently reviewed the source and found that exclusive logic is being applied to half of the rectangle, whereas the other half uses inclusive logic. The fix would simply be to change < to <= in the Contains methods, but since the behaviour may be intentional (although I fail to see why) I have been hesitant to make a pull request.

data.title: Segmentation fault when compiling fonts
data.body:
I'm fairly sure this is caused by the new 64-bit font DLL upgrade.  This is the stacktrace:

```
Stacktrace:

  at <unknown> <0xffffffff>
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) object.__icall_wrapper_mono_string_new_wrapper (intptr) <IL 0x0000d, 0xffffffff>
  at (wrapper unknown) SharpFont.Internal.FaceRec.PtrToStructure (intptr,object) <IL 0x00254, 0xffffffff>
  at (wrapper runtime-invoke) <Module>.runtime_invoke_void_intptr_object (object,intptr,intptr,intptr) <IL 0x0005c, 0xffffffff>
  at <unknown> <0xffffffff>
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.PtrToStructure (intptr,System.Type) <IL 0x0000e, 0xffffffff>
  at SharpFont.PInvokeHelper.PtrToStructure<T> (intptr) <IL 0x0000b, 0x0002c>
  at SharpFont.Face.set_Reference (intptr) <IL 0x00026, 0x00033>
  at SharpFont.Face..ctor (SharpFont.Library,string,int) <IL 0x00022, 0x00113>
  at SharpFont.Library.NewFace (string,int) <IL 0x0001b, 0x00047>
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.SharpFontImporter.CreateFontFace (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription,string) [0x0000a] in /home/james/Projects/Redpoint/Tychaia/Protogame/ThirdParty/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Graphics/Font/SharpFontImporter.cs:79
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.SharpFontImporter.Import (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription,string) [0x0000f] in /home/james/Projects/Redpoint/Tychaia/Protogame/ThirdParty/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Graphics/Font/SharpFontImporter.cs:32
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.ImportFont (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription,single&,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext,string) [0x0009f] in /home/james/Projects/Redpoint/Tychaia/Protogame/ThirdParty/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Processors/FontDescriptionProcessor.cs:149
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.Process (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext) [0x00138] in /home/james/Projects/Redpoint/Tychaia/Protogame/ThirdParty/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Processors/FontDescriptionProcessor.cs:78
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessor`2.Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentProcessor.Process (object,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext) [0x00041] in /home/james/Projects/Redpoint/Tychaia/Protogame/ThirdParty/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/ContentProcessor.cs:60
  at Protogame.FontAssetCompiler.CompileFont (Protogame.FontAsset,Protogame.TargetPlatform) [0x00058] in /home/james/Projects/Redpoint/Tychaia/Protogame/Protogame/Assets/FontAssetCompiler.cs:111
  at Protogame.FontAssetCompiler.Compile (Protogame.FontAsset,Protogame.TargetPlatform) [0x00004] in /home/james/Projects/Redpoint/Tychaia/Protogame/Protogame/Assets/FontAssetCompiler.cs:51
  at Protogame.DefaultTransparentAssetCompiler/AssetCompilerProxy`1.Compile (Protogame.IAsset,Protogame.TargetPlatform) [0x0000e] in /home/james/Projects/Redpoint/Tychaia/Protogame/Protogame/Assets/DefaultTransparentAssetCompiler.cs:131
```

I'm not sure whether because it's 64-bit, it's now able to load the version of freetype that resides at /usr/lib64/libfreetype.so.6, which is incompatible with the version that MonoGame is shipping.

data.title: Copy OpenTK.dll.config on build
data.body: Currently MonoGame doesn't copy OpenTK.dll.config, which prevented @thefiddler's changes from actually taking effect.

data.title: Warning Cleanup
data.body:
We could use a pass cleaning up warnings in the build logs.

You just need to look at the [build log from the last successful build](http://teamcity.monogame.net/viewLog.html?buildTypeId=MonoGame_DevelopWin&buildId=lastSuccessful&buildBranch=%3Cdefault%3E&tab=buildLog&guest=1) and search for "warning".

data.title: Documentation Fixes
data.body:
A few documentation fixes:
- Disabled doc XML warnings during automated builds to reduce the log file noise.
- Fixed unnecessary relative path.

data.title: Relocate platform specific stuff from Game
data.body:
I've removed all of the `#if PLATFORM` bits I easily can from Game.

The remaining ones are:
WINDOWS_STOREAPP ViewStateChanged
ANDROID Activity
WINRT PreviousExecutionState
WINRT Task.Delay vs Thread.Sleep

These are probably okay to stay here for now at least.

Fixes #1973

data.title: Moving To 64bit Content Building
data.body:
We've decided to drop official support for running the new MGCB (MonoGame content builder) tool in 32bit.
- Better supports building large content.
- Easier to maintain one set of binary dependencies.
- Most all developer machines support 64bit.
- MacOS is 64bit only.

data.title: Android clip rectangle position is off
data.body:
Clip rectangle in Android comes up in the wrong place. My experience say that its 20 pixels too far to the left on a 10" android screen. I haven't tested yet to see if its relative to screen pixel size.

Here's an example of my code running on OSX:
![screen shot 2014-04-25 at 12 37 14 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4048613/2809056/2f5ea596-cd56-11e3-8e12-4842602122e1.png)

And here is the exact same code running on Android 4.3, 10" WXGA
![screen shot 2014-04-25 at 12 36 50 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4048613/2809058/4134a77a-cd56-11e3-87a4-e94b4241d75d.png)

data.title: Use threading function in WP8 FromStream
data.body: As suggested by @totallyeviljake in #2307

data.title: Android resume (sometimes) not reloading textures + possible explanation
data.body:
Hi!

I'm having problems resuming android apps. Some users say it works, but it's definitively not working in my devices  (it's usually the opposite :) )

I'd like to share this log:  http://pastebin.com/Fw12GbV3

In points 1 and 2, surface is destroyed preparing for "tombstone".

In points 3, 4 and 5 surface is "recreated". 

However, the content reload is run in AndroidGameWindow.CreateFrameBuffer, but the log "AndroidGameWindow.CreateFrameBuffer" is not printed. I fail to understand why, but it's obvious that the content won't be reloaded if CreateFrameBuffer is not called.

Thanks!
Kak

data.title: DX11 HLSL Missing Samplers
Made TextureCube.SetData take a generic type.
data.body: Similar to the earlier change to Texture3D, I need the type to calculate some offsets in the platform method. We have some ideas to make everything cleaner, but this is a decent minimal change for now.

data.title: Implement PNG and JPG Reader/Writer
data.body:
Our current path of using platform provided PNG/JPG readers/writers is unreliable.  Not implemented one some platforms, threading issues on others, and generally different behaviors across all platforms.

We want to remove these platform differences by including our own simple implementations written purely in C#.  Some rules for these readers/writers:
- Requires no extra binary dependencies.
- Single source file.
- Must be safe to read/write PNGs from multiple threads simultaneously.
- No GPL or LGPL licenses.
- Readers should be pretty flexible.
- Writes need little flexibility if any.

For PNG we talked about these for readers...

  http://code.google.com/p/pngcs/
  http://lodev.org/lodepng/
  http://lodev.org/lodepng/picopng.cpp

PicoPNG seems like the best choice being under 500 lines of code, but it needs conversion to C#.

We haven't identified a good PNG writer yet.

For JPEG we have a few suggestions...

  http://keyj.emphy.de/nanojpeg/
  https://github.com/Deathspike/NanoJPEG.NET
  http://code.google.com/p/fjcore/

NanoJPG which already has a C# port seems like the best choice so far.

We haven't identified a good JPG writer yet.

We will put these implementations into the existing utilities folder:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/tree/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Utilities

 ... one file for each with names like PngReader, PngWriter, JpgReader, JpgWriter.  We change their namespace to be within `MonoGame.Utilities` and make sure API feels sufficiently C# like and common possibly passing a `Stream` to them directly.  We need to make sure the only things public are the external API to use the library.  We will keep all the original author comments and license info for attribution of the original work.

We would then use these helpers across all platforms removing all platform specific PNG/JPG code within MonoGame.

data.title: Add missing parameters to platform methods on Texture3D
data.body:
A few little--but important--things here:
- Some of the parameters were left out in the API split, but it turns out we did need them.
- Moved the interop marshalling into the platform files to keep alloc/free near the resource usage and consistent with the others.
- Renamed member variables to follow the underscore prefix convention. SetData used the same names for a different meaning and it was confusing.

data.title: InvalidFramebufferOperation in GL.Viewport when renderbuffer is bound
Fixed test compilation on MacOS
data.body: This PR fixes MonoGame.Tests.MacOS, which was failing to compile before.

data.title: Undo a iOS AOT Workaround
data.body:
The iOS AOT handles this fine now (probably has for quite a while), so `<T>` the Item.
Typing was initially removed in 24a31a9a50542e70103baf1dbf06797d7e219e4f
